Computer Programming for Social Scientists Tom Paskhalis, Department of Politican Science, Trinity College Dublin 2021-2022 About this course TBA Materials The following texts provide a good introduction to Python and R programming with a focus on data analysis applications: Guttag, John. 2021 Introduction to Computation and Programming Using Python: With Application to Computational Modeling and Understanding Data. 3rd ed. Cambridge, MA: The MIT Press Matloff, Norman. 2011. The Art of R Programming: A Tour of Statistical Software Design. San Francisco, CA: No Starch Press. McKinney, Wes. 2017. Python for Data Analysis: Data Wrangling with Pandas, NumPy, and IPython. 2nd ed. Sebastopol, CA: O’Reilly Media Sweigart, Al. 2019. Automate the Boring Stuff with Python. 2nd ed. San Francisco, CA: No Starch Press Wickham, Hadley, and Garrett Grolemund. 2017. R for Data Science: Import, Tidy, Transform, Visualize, and Model Data. Sebastopol, CA: O’Reilly Media. Additional online resources: Python For You and Me Python Wikibook Python 3 documentation (intermediate and advanced) R documentation R Inferno
